name: Be Live Grand Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I know what everyone on here is thinking....here she goes again, we know she loves this resort...what else can she have to say ??!! Well here it goes...
reviews.title: 6th time, everyone knows we love this resort !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival was smooth, after finally meeting Victor at the front desk we were whisked off to block 7 to check in with Luisia and Crismilda who were wonderful. Dargenis then took us to our rooms but we knew where our room was since we have stayed in it 4 other years ! We love this room...my parents were at the opposite end two doors down ocean view aswell. There were alot of new additions to that area....the room that we check in has changed into more of a lobby area for block 7 guests....more chairs and tables have been added...snacks are out all the time, coffee is available there at all times, fully stocked bar and 4 computers. This was nice to have, we really had no need to visit the main lobby except to say hi to some of the employees we have met over the years. Also new to block 7 is a vip bar area on the beach....this was a great addition. At this bar we also had hotdogs, pizza and nachos always available so we really didnt have to go to far all day long....it was great with our girls if they were hungry to just go to this area for snacks....bottles of water and pop were always available aswell. Yonathan did an excellent job working this bar and on his days off Amelio took over and looked after us just aswell ! The bali beds on the beach are also a nice touch...it was great to be able to have an afternoon nap on them instead of a lounge.
reviews.title: So Glad to be Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had zero issues with food and we were there for two weeks. For breakfast everyday we headed over to Aqua...Hose was always around to take care of us, he is the best ! Antonio makes the best omelettes and after a few days he was cracking the eggs before we even said what we wanted !! Lunch was usually by our vip bar and if we did want fries, onion or tomatoe we went over to the beach grill and brought it back to add to our hotdogs and ate on our terrace. Dinners were good aswell.....Luisia, Crismilda, Jesus, Fernando and Argenis made all our dinner reservations for us...looked after ordering us the lobster dinner to have at any of the a la cartes which we did three times during our stay. Its a fee of 22 but well worth it, I couldnt eat a quarter of the lobster I was given each night. We enjoyed the sports bar a la carte restaurant....grilled chicken, wings, ribs and who could resist having Louie as your waiter....he made our day, he is the happiest guy on the resort !! The japenesse was very good too....the hostess which I think her name was Rosa or Rosie...was very upbeat and the service there was great. Food was amazing, fresh chicken, beef and shrimp. We ate there twice and on our second time there was a lady with an allergy at our table and he did her food first and then our shrimp so if you speak to the employees in a respectable manner it is possible to ask for things and get your point across. We also ate at the Italian which was good but a little chilly at night...so take a sweater ladies ! The other nights we went to the buffet and always found something to eat and I must admit that after two weeks the food was a little bland but that is not their fault, its just what we are used to. I am also a firm believer of raising an issue if there is a problem while there instead of coming on here and ranting and raving.....we noticed that the first two or three days the bacon at aqua each morning was hardly cooked....we were taking it over to the grill and having it cooked more so while talking to Victor one morning I mentioned it to him, he spoke to the food service manage and from then on our bacon was crispy !! I also introduced myself to the food service manager and thanked him, he was doing an excellent job and he was also seen at all the restaurants and bars throughout the day. He was also severly busy trying to keep the drunk students in thier wet swimsuits out of the buffet each night, he had his hands full !!
reviews.title: Wonderful Time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Now on to spring breakers....yes there were alot of them...yes they were pretty drunk but they could only do that the first couple of days and then we noticed it started to catch up to them....they were quieter as the week went on. We were thankful to be over in block 7 which we call the quiet area !
reviews.title: STAY AWAY!!!!!! Bad Service & Dirty rooms/property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Beach was great as usual....all our vendor friends were back, they dont bother us. When we dont see them on the beach we wonder where they are ! Seaweed was the same as other years...maybe abit more the odd day but the weather was windy so its not the hotels fault if there is seaweed and the guys cleaning up the beach did their best. How could they rake when we kept taking their shovels and rakes to build our massive sand castle each day !! These guys got a kick out of my dad asking to borrow their shovel. The beach is amazing and that is why we go back, to sit and relax and we enjoy seeing our friends walking up and down the beach. The lifestyle vacation guys stood by us for the entire two weeks and didnt once bother us, they guarded our castle while we went for lunch most days and we did witness them approach people walking on the beach and it the people said no, they didnt nag them....they let them keep walking. We did not find them aggressive at all.
reviews.title: Great Birthday Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I cannot say enough about the friendly, helpful service we received at this resort. Top to bottom, everything was great.Food was great and always accompanied by a smiling server.The bar was helpful getting you everything you wanted.
reviews.title: Great service, but watch the Casino !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only issue came at the casino. When delt 4 kings in a hand of Caribbean Poker, the rules changed dramaticaly ! I could tell that things got a little tense on the casino's side when the dealer turned over my hand.Things were said and I was paid a small portion of what my pay out should have been.The dealer tried to start another hand, but my fellow players ( 2 Russians and a Brazilian gentlrman) knew I was getting shafted.The lady standing beside the dealer said the payout list only applied if I bought insurance.You cannot buy insurance in this game.Finally the boss lady came over and explained to me that the 20 to 1 payout only applied to the ante bet of $20, and not to the secondary $ 40 bet. She then paid me $ 400, as the dealer had tried to rush me through with a $ 200 payout.I was not getting my $ 800. All other bets were paid on the ante and the follow up bet. So be ware ! Everything was good until I won.
reviews.title: Good holiday,beware the russians

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Went here for 2 weeks in January. Rooms comfortable and big. Food good if you use the various dining options available especially the Gourmet restaurant. Beach nice,always plenty of sunbeds. Lots of pools but sunbeds always taken. Only downside is Russians who seem to think they are the only guests,going to the front of queues and drinking everything available in the largest receptacles they can find. This happens 24/7 as drinks are served all night. By 5.00 pm they are all falling over each other. It didn't spoil our holiday at all but put me off having a holiday in their country
reviews.title: Be Live Grand Bavaro Cameleon Gold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from a week vacation at the Be LIve Grand Bavaro and loved it. From the moment we arrived at the Punta Cana airport, the locals and Nolitour reps greeted us with warm friendly smiles. The rooms were ready before promised and we loved the location of our rooms in building 14. Booking through Nolitours was organized and we got everything we were promised. We had three separate pools and a bar in our section which was very private and quiet and about a 5 min. walk to the beach and main pool if you wanted more entertainment. The rooms were very clean and updated. There were never any concerns about getting a beach chair and there are so many bars/pools, the area never seemed crowded even though the resort was sold out. We tried the Mexican, Gourmet, Italian and Sports bar and enjoyed all of them and through out our entire stay none of us got sick. The beach is beautiful and swimming is good although if you walk a little down the beach, there is a gorgeous unspoiled beach that is awesome for swimming. It did get a little noisy at night with the festival and the roosters but not the hotel's fault. There are so many great tours like the Caribean Festival swimming with the stingrays and sharks and the Ziplining. We loved this place and would recommend it if you book through Nolitours and get a really good price.
reviews.title: how can u overlook the theme from the other reviewers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed 7 nights
reviews.title: WOULD NEVER GO BACK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was like a breath of fresh air, we had trouble at another resort and came to Be Live and they treated us like family,( Jesus Mateo was AMAZING Front desk) The resort was Beautiful. the Beach was a white soft sand. It was all inclusive and worth every penny,Be sure you make reservations at the other dinning areas on site, The only compliant, I had was we didnt get to stay long enough. Dont hesitate You will LOVE IT. Tell Jesus ,Jackie and Lee said Hi
reviews.title: Be Live Grand Punta Cana, Is where you want to go.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I unfortuantely booked through travizon, and my agent did not specify in my interary email that I needed to bring with me to check in a voucher showing my confirmation of booking. Luckily I did print what I did have via email and that helped the front desk confirm my reservation. I was with a group of four and because we were frustrated with checking in the rooms manager Victor was brought in to help us. He was great and really wanted to make sure we were happy. He graciously upgraded are rooms to the King Suites side(Fabulous accomadations) where I would only stay when I go back again. It had a private pool area, indoor lounge area with unlimited top shelf, and free computer use and a private poolside bar as well. The staff was really friendly in our lounge area, Jay, and Chrismilda especially. Anyway, make dinner reservations for the week and just talk with the staff and they wil help you with anything. See Victor for any room issues he really wants to make sure you enjoy your stay!!!
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I arrived on Feb 21 and were greated at the front door by Jesus who advised that the Hotel Manager Victor upgraded us to Building #7 for our 25th wedding Anniversary during our stay. I ddi e-mail Vicior before our arrival date, but didn't expect what he did for us. We checked in at building #7 and were met by Lucia who provided us with a cold beverage and explained everything about our stay including giving us our dinner reservations for the week. Our room was on the top floor overlooking the Ocean. We had the best room in the entire resort with a hot tub on the Balcony, and a jaccuzi tub inside the room. Everything went wonderful the rest of the week. All of the Restaurants were wondeerful. We tried all of them, including the "Windows" buffett and Aqua buffet. We never had any ill effects from the food. ALL water given at the resort is bottled water, so there are no worries. The swimming pools were spread throughout the resort, so one can always be found. The beach was wonderful. Yes, there is sea weed, but the workers rake them up 2-3 times a day, so its really no big deal..
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at the Be Live Grand Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: STAFF: All of the employees treated us great. Their is plenty of security around the proplert, so no worries there. We did have approx 500 college students arrive on sat/sun, but they were never an issue either.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!
Probelms with overbooking, stay far away from this hotel
reviews.text: OVERALL+ I would rate this hotel a 4 star, with the employees I talked to a 5 star. My suggestion would be to e-mail Victor P a few weeks before arrival and let hom know if you have any special Anniversary or birthday during your stay. He is such a great person, and 'Im sure he will try to help you in any way if he can.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We knew there had been changes to the hotel and our beloved Caren had left but we decided to book this hotel because we love the location and size of it. We are creatures of habit and wanted to arrive and be able to start enjoying our holiday and know where everything is right away and by going back for the 5th year we knew this could happen.
reviews.title: 5th time is a charm !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didnt book as early as we usually do ( oct ) we booked early Jan for a late Feb arrival but for 11 days, 10 nights this year. I had been emailing the hotel when booking and got in contact with Gemma and she treated us wonderfully......then we were in contact with Ina regarding my husband and father going golfing one day, taking a cab up to Bavaro to meet Caren for lunch at the Acqua Beach Club and so on about themes of the buffet and such. These two ladies always emailed me back and it was peace of mind knowing that the hotel was going through changes but our holiday would still be the same.
reviews.title: Great food and service - had a wonderful time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did skypark in Toronto which was slick and easy....arrived at Pearson at 4 am , flew out at 6....great flight with sunwing. With being up all night the six of us slept most of the way and woke up just in time to land in punta cana. The airport was quick, paid a guy to take our luggage right to the sunwing booth and find out what number the be-live bus was....20 mins later we were off to the be-live. We checked in but our rooms were not ready....we had asked for 2 rooms ground level to the lazy river but there was only one available so we got the walk out to the lazy river and my parents took the walk out to the courtyard/garden area. We were abit dissapointed but we were in block 7 so all was good....upgraded bracelets to dine at any restaurant which was perfect since we really enjoy eating at Aqua for breakfast instead of the windows buffet. Our rooms were going to be ready at 3 so we changed and went down by the pool area and had drinks and got burgers and pizza from the beach grill and started our holiday. Rooms arent usually ready in canada until 3 so what is the big deal ?! David and Edquardo were great to deal with at the front desk.....Edquardo had only worked there a month so I told him we had been here longer than him, he had a chuckle. They were both super helpfull all week when we had questions. Ina was also around when we checked in to go over our rooms with his, super nice girl who works her butt off each day !! We met Gemma on day two and she was wonderful to us....it is great going to a place that you can walk through the lobby and say hello to people and they know who you are...its a great feeling.
reviews.title: This resort comparable to any other .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: At 3 we went back to the desk...they said the rooms were not quite ready but we were welcome to take our luggage over there and rest by the lazy river....my parents room was ready but they were just about to clean ours which was fine....we sat on the terrace and the girls swam. First night was an early one since we had been up all night. Our room was perfect....we loved our room facing the ocean but it was windy the first few days of our trip so we rather liked that we didnt get the wind on the side of the block instead of being hit straight on. My parents had a great room, it was like we had our own lawn .....no wind late afternoon, full sun if you wanted it and very quiet....we all had lounges over by their room around 4 pm and we napped !! Dreams kitchen was right there but we never noticed any noise from it and from their terrace you could see the ocean still.
reviews.title: Great Vacation - tip a little and often - and savour ALL the experiences!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach.....same as ever, beautiful and we had the largest and best sandcastles of all !!! Everyday was a new castle with each day getting bigger and better. All our vendor friends were back, Teeta braided the girls hair again, Tony treats us like family...got to know a few other vendors quite well, they ended up bringing their family to the beach to meet us.....if your nice to them, they will be nice back. We didnt buy much from any of them because after being there 5 years we havent got much left to buy but our girls always like to buy a bracelet or something and my mom buys all kinds of stuff....cigars to take home, a hat for her....wraps and a dress....they love her ! The first few days there was more seaweed than usual but it was windy those days and then after day 3 the wind went down and there wasnt much seaweed coming in but the staff continued to clean up the beach.....we usually took the rack from the one guy to rack around our castle and keep it tidy...he got a kick out of us doing his job and then we would load up his pockets with chips and candy. Our security guard on the beach "Franchesco" is a great guy...timeshare/lifestyle guys were pushy when we first got there but after we told them we were not interested and it didnt make sense for us to join.....they left us alone. Okay...I did bribe the guy one day with candy and food to zip his mouth....one guy was rather mouthy and didnt understand we werent interested but after I gave him some candy and chips he was great the next 8 days !! It makes no sense for us to buy into the lifestyle plan....we vacation there once a year....we arent retired and can go 52 weeks a year anywhere in the world and the cost of our airfare from ontario is basically the same as an all inclusive pkg.
reviews.title: TELL IT ONLY TO YOUR BEST FRIENDS!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the truth.
reviews.title: Its not that bad!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first time to the Dominican and my boyfriends third
reviews.title: If you stay at this Resort you will likely be robbed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This resort is not a 5 star, more like a 3 and a half to a 4. They have changed owners many times in the last few years, and from we heard it’s getting a lot better! We stayed in building 3 and had no problems it was a nice room, clean and we saw no bugs. We heard bad things about building 5, when you arrive if you refuse it right away they will find you a new room.
reviews.title: The Food was good, shows were good and room was clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is friendly, and they are good at what they do. They work 16 hour days and sometimes it takes them a while to clean your room or re fill your mini bar but it will be done before 7pm. Remember you are in a third world country, it's not going to be the same as it is at home. Our mini bar only had what we were allowed to have in it, 2 sodas, 2 beers and a big bottle of water per day so we had no additional charges. If they add additional items to your mini bar, the man that drops it off speaks English and you can tell him to only put what your aloud to have in there (friends we met did this) The bottles of water can be filled at the bar no charge and the water is safe, so there is no need to pay for extras, you can also keep the bottles and use them over and over.
reviews.title: run!!! all of these reviews are true!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When booking an excursion book through your travel agent, when you do it that way you know what you are getting. There are sales people walking around, but just say no and try not to make eye contact they usually don’t bug you. If they do just say no thanks and walk away (I found this to be the most annoying part of the resort)
reviews.title: Choose another resort - You can do better for your money and not be frustrated all the time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: I have stayed here before. A pretty standard all-inclusive resort. Best thing is there is VIP staff and bars here for Lifestyle members really enhanced the stay. The Lifestyle VIP staff is attentive to your every need.
reviews.title: Just a normal all-inclusive resort on a nice beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a very good time. Food was very good and a a good variety of restaurants Japanese Italian,French ,Brazilian,Mexican and buffet were all good. Beach was perfect and pool was good .
reviews.title: Be Live Punta Cana March 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best part of trip was VIP staff of Fernando,David and Desiret who were always there to help and make sure my wife and I were taken care of.
reviews.title: Great Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Entertainment was plentiful and varied always something going on.
reviews.title: Our vacation was very nice the staff was very excellent the service was very good we would come back again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay here. The rooms are very clean and the service is first rate, especially David, Yanelly, Fernando, Nicolas, Sthen and Lilly Anders in the v.i.p. lounge. Santiago in the v.i.p. beach bar is great and alot of fun.
reviews.title: Good trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Jimmy Garcia (service manager) and Tio Lois (kids mini camp) made our stay awesome! Without them our vacation would not have been the same.
reviews.title: Nice sandy beaches with beautiful palm trees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was fantastic which made up for the "run down" aspect of this hotel. They tried hard but the hotel rooms are in need of refurbishing.
reviews.title: Had a good time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have the weirdest beach & pool chairs that are not the most practical.
reviews.title: Wonderful, First Time Experince, in the DR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kicker is the guys hasseling you for services and trying to sell you future vacation packages.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was not 5* but we had a blast. The staff was great. The food is okay. Room clean, beach nice. Buffet okay for breakfast. Beach Restaurant was nice for lunch & dinner. You don't go to the Dominican for food and golf, but you won't starve or get bored. The drinks are great! Pool was fun. Lots of Canadians there & heard many languages. Bldg 3 by the pool is a nice spot to be. You make it what you want it to be. You can party it up or you can relax & be quiet. We were with a group, so it made it more special & fun.
reviews.title: "BEWARE"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved our vacation at Be Live and would return without hesitation. Highly recommend staying in Bloque 7, VIP section. Upgrade is worth it; service is excellent. David Panou was always there when we had a question with a smile on his face. The lounge always had food and Esther was most helpful with restaurant reservations, internet service, etc. Maria always left our room spotless. Santiago at VIP bar at beach served us drinks with great enthusiasm and a happy face.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This place is not worth whatever deal you get, trust me. I got a great deal through Groupon and thought it couldn't be that bad...well it was. The place is FILLED with Russians, who are beyond rude. The rooms were dated and need lots of repair. The food was okay at best. Pool was chilly, it and needs an update as well. The restaurant and bar staff were great, the front desk...not so much. If you go to Punta Cana, pay the extra to stay at a 5 star resort and the experience will be worth it. Will not be back to this dump.
reviews.title: Awful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Two family trip to Be Live, first time there. Overall it's a nice resort but its a little dated. Renovations are underway within the resort. We stayed in building 4 with an ocean view, however were right beside the beach restaurant and were up most of the night listening to glasses clinking and staff talking while they cleaned. We upgraded to a new modern room in building 3 which was nice.
reviews.title: Overall a good family vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food at buffet is pretty good. The a la carte restaurants: Brazillian, Japanese and Gourment were all good. The italian was not and would recommend skipping it.
reviews.title: Much better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Bars were pretty good, however many of the drinks i wanted I couldn't get. Mojitos were not made properly and so I stuck to the drinks the bartendars knew how to make which wasn't so bad.
reviews.title: First time reviewer from Montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from this resort on March 4th. Traveling to this resort was not as bad as I thought it would be after reading all the negative reveiws. There was also alot of confusion about what side is what in reading the reveiws for this resort. We stayed on the Bavaro side which was rated a 4.5 star. I would say it was more like a 4 star which in the carribean is what I classify as an okay place to stay for a week but will likely have something you will not like about it. When I visit the Dominican I don't go with to high expectations which everyone should learn to do as we are not in Canada and there standards are not the same.
reviews.title: Not So Bad!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our check in was fast and we were greeted with happy staff, a drink, and a bottle of rum. You do have to pay for the safe and there was a bit of a wait but not bad. There is one guy acdevating the safe so be patient. The room was clean and we did have to wait for towels on few occasions, and the fridge water and beer we had to wait a couple of times as well. We just saved an empty bottle so we could fill it at the bar. No worries the water is safe at the bars. This avoids you not having water.
reviews.title: Relax... reviews are misleading-hotel is more than adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was very good at this resort. The aqua restuarant was very good and we ate here most of the time. The Windows I didn't really like, the Mexican was good and so was the Japanese. These two you need reservations for. The snack bar at the beach is very good as well only I don't recommend eating the burgers as they seemed not to be cooked all the way through sometimes.
reviews.title: Beautiful Beach, pools, terrible service, travelling packs of time share pests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is nice however I think the beaches down at the bavaro end are nicer and less seaweed down there. Don't get me wrong it was nice here to but when I travel it is all about how nice the beach is as this is where I am the whole time of my stay. THis area is not considered Bavaro beach which I didn't realize until we arrived and I was talking with a local on the beach. If you want to book excurisons on your trip, try to go to the locals on the beach. They will bend over backwards to accomadate you with everything you want for a cheaper price then through the hotel. We were taken out snorkeling, a boat ride up to the other end (Bavaro Beach) where all the resorts are, then taken into a shallow cove to swim, and taken out to get a close look at the dolpins. We were not rushed at all through this excursion and where out for about 2 hours for $25.00 a person. Good deal!!!!! There are also shops outside the resort across the road. There stuff is cheaper then on the resort. They are pushy so if you don't like this don't go. I personnally didn't have an issue, you just have to say no thank you.
reviews.title: Was not What we Expected Even Given the Reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the staff to be very friendly on the resort as well. Always happy and singing. Tips go a long way when staying in this country so be kind. Whats a dollar here and there.
reviews.title: Very Pleased again
3 star at best
reviews.text: Stayed Feb 24th to Mar 3rd. Resort was fine, rooms were clean and a good size. Staff were good but did not go out of their way. The Al a Cartes were a disappointment except the Japanese and Brazilian. Food was luke warm and not anything special. Beach was good, short walk away from the dock and you had a very nice swimming area. Activity Staff were very engaging.

reviews.title: Overall - satisfied
reviews.text: Stayed at Be Live Grand Bavaro from February 26 - march 6. The first 2 nights were pretty rough due to the room I was assigned. Building 11 - top right corner. Musty smell and very noisy. However, I requested to be moved . The front desk clerks were co- operative and friendly, with no issues whatsoever. I really like the fact that the resort was smaller and that I didn't have to walk miles to the beach or buffet! The beach was well kept

reviews.title: Be Live P. C. entertainment staff Frank, Coke Cola and Akon FUN!
reviews.text: The shows were ok... The disco was ok as well, except beware that you have to pay for your drinks there! I travelled solo, but still had tonnes of fun! I rarely say I would return to a resort because I like to check out other resorts, but I think I would return! There are two sides to this resort. Be sure to stay on the Bavaro side...much nicer.

reviews.title: Be Live Grand Bavaro, Punta Cana
reviews.text: The buffet was great, although I was buffet 'ed out by the time I returned! All in all I was happy and that's what a vacation is all about!! :)

reviews.title: Very good time!
reviews.text: Overall experience was great for this family of four!!!! Ages...50, 49. 21 and 16. Stayed Feb 28th to March 7th 2013.The rooms were very clean and spacious, cleaning staff very nice and helpful. We tipped and shopped in American only. Hotel staff very nice. The entertainment staff Frank, Coke Cola and Akon were very good at getting people involved in having fun even if it was just watching. The evening entertainment was typical. The grounds were well taken care of on a daily basics. The buffet food was good something for every pallet. Of course the beach was great and the water. Get up early to save a lounge chair with your towel especially under shade at pool and beach. Lots available in the sun. The locals are very friendly, did not feel scared one bit. The Moon Disco was another way to see the locals dance and visitors from other hotels too, as it is open to them at a $5 door charge. You also have to pay for drinks there too. Weather was very good to great which helps. Get rid of the pesky VIP white shirts staff, just keep telling them you already done it while walking away. Lots of rude Russians before the March Break. We will return some time!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are return guests to the Be Live Grand and we wont be going to any other resort, we love it there. Our flight down with Sunwing was great, nice and smooth and on time. We did a private transfer with Conexion Tours who met as at the airport and took us directly to the hotel in 20 mins. We arrived at Be Live to be greeted by Luisa who we met last year. By then Nicolas was there to take our bags to our room. We had 2 rooms in block 2 ground floor with oceanview, these rooms are new in the last 6 months. Blocks 2, 3 and 4 all have new additions to the front of them which give these blocks oceanview rooms now. The resort has had many changes and upgrades since we were there last Feb. and they are all very positive changes. Fernando, David and Nicolas looked after all our needs, they were never far away if we needed anything and it was always enjoyable to chat to them. In the block 7 lounge Esther and Desiree were there to make our dinner reservations and help out with the wifi cards. Santiago and Emilio worked the VIP bar at our pool which my husband and dad visited quite abit. The best part about going back to this resort is seeing all the workers that we have met in the past 8 years.....Jose, Orlando and Luis look after us at breakfast at the beach grill.....Delesio makes sure we have excellent dinners at the sports bar. Franci brought us room service for lunch, he was always around to give him our order and came back with it within the hour. Ana was our housekeeper, our room was always kept clean....she would bring back plenty of towels and did turn down service and leave hersey kisses on our pillow ! We would also trade her the diet coke and orange for all cokes which was quite the show of charades the first day we tried to do this but after that she knew what we wanted and just handed us more coke !! We dont have issues with the timeshare guys on the beach, we say we arent interested and that is it. My husband and daughter went parasailing and we did book it with our vendor friend Philip on the beach and everything was fine, my daughter and dad went again the next week and they loved it aswell. We know 90% of the vendors that walk the beach and there is never a dull moment, if they see us they chat but they never bug or harass us to buy what they are selling. Its part of sitting on the beach on an island, there are going to be guys trying to sell stuff, it is their way of life. We did notice that the grounds of the resort are much cleaner and tidy, shrubs are all trimmed...there were always guys raking the beach or cleaning the pools. Our fan did not work when we checked in and it was fixed that day, little things that I mentioned to Victor were looked after. I am happy to let everyone know that there are ladders in the lazy river pool now !! 8 years ago there were ladders at both ends and then the next year they were gone, probably broke and just never replaced. I know of people who dont go to this resort because they cant get into the pools...so now they can...very sturdy ladders have been added to both sets of steps of the lazy river, thank you Victor !! As far as food goes....the 6 of us never got sick, we ate at the beach grill everyday and they cooked us bacon, we just had to ask. Lunch was back at the beach grill or room service and suppers were at the buffet or a la cartes.....we went to the sports bar 4 times, italian once, japenese and gourmet. We did pay for lobster one night and it was well worth it. The VIP lounge had snacks out during the day and night so you never went hungry. The lobby bar is a nice addition to the hotel and Danni looks after you there. It was nice to sit in the lobby at night after dinner. The hotel had much better entertainment this year down by the pool bar at night....flame juggler, musicians, ice skating rink....every night was something different and fun to watch. The hotel photographers are now located above the pool bar which was nice and convient to check our pictures each night....Francesa was our photographer and took some great family pics of us. Well that pretty much sums up our 2 weeks at Be Live....rooms were excellent, food was great, staff was beyond friendly...we met some great people who we became friends with from all over the world, we made the best sand castles and had numerous people take pictures of them, relaxed and got a great tan ! We are already counting down until we return next year. Victor Pollantis is a great rooms division manager, he makes our stay so enjoyable because we never have to worry about a thing !! Our last day at the resort we went to check out at 11 and noticed a posting that our flight was delayed.....back to our rooms we went for the entire day, that is a bonus with this resort being so close to the airport, you get to stay there instead of sitting at the airport. We sat by the pool for the day and said our goodbyes again that night....then to the airport to find out we werent flying until 11pm...we all wished we were back at the resort !!! See you next year Be Live :)
reviews.title: Great stay as usual :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We traveled to the Be Live Punta Cana on March 5th for a week. This is my 4th trip to Punta Cana in the past year so I had expectations of what the resort would be. This was not it. You know those long driveways that you are taken down to get to your resort.. not here... it"s right off the road.
reviews.title: The Good, the Bad ( mostly bad)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: When we had booked the trip we reviewed the Trip advisor entries for the resort and they all seemed fine however the week before we left, there were numerous reports of people getting sick, hospitalized etc.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good
reviews.title: Be Live a Grand Experience !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.title: Be Live Or Be Forgotten

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I was very pleased with my visit! I stayed in building #15, which was beautiful! I was told that the best rooms are #10-15... So definitely stay in those! Near the building #15 there was a mini bar where the bartender named Nicolas worked at! He was GREAT! He always had a "drink of the day" and really put in effort with his drinks. My favourite was "Banana Mama" where he used real bananas in a blender.
reviews.title: "Be Live Grand Punta Cana - Feb 2012"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The A la Carte restaurants were great! My favourite was the Japanese. They cook every thing in front of you and you pick what you'd like to eat. The brazillian restaurant was also delicious. A lot of barbequed meat where they walk around to each table and cut a piece off for you.
reviews.title: Watch your patio doors especially ground floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing went missing in our room and it was always cleaned daily with new towels replaced. The staff was all very friendly too!
reviews.title: really really horrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They had a theatre where they had a different show every night. My favourite was the Michael Jackson show. I was very surprised.. It was AWESOME! Also, the international night was good too. They had many different types of dances from different countries which was very well done. They did a lot of impressive lifts.
reviews.title: Be Live Grand Bavaro 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I loved my experience at Be live grand punta cana and would definitely go back!
reviews.title: It was OK but would not return!!

description: The Be Live Hotel Grand Punta Cana is an exclusive all-inclusive 5-star hotel resort in Punta Cana that has been especially designed for those who wish to spend their holidays with their family, get away from it all with their partner, or enjoy a holiday among friends with an authentic touch of the Caribbean.
